markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Weapon 0"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Club](/Weapons.aspx?ID=357)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Thrown 10 ft." url="/Traits.aspx?ID=195" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 277 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Favored Weapon** [Barzahk](/Deities.aspx?ID=534), [Green Man](/Deities.aspx?ID=666), [Halcamora](/Deities.aspx?ID=120), [Halcamorra](/Deities.aspx?ID=647), [Shumunue](/Deities.aspx?ID=695), [Valani](/Deities.aspx?ID=486)

<row gap="medium">
**Price** —

**Damage** 1d6 B

**Bulk** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Hands** 1

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Type** Melee

**Category** Simple

**Group** [Club](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=5)
</row>

</column>

---

This is a piece of stout wood shaped or repurposed to bludgeon an enemy. Clubs can be intricately carved pieces of martial art or as simple as a tree branch or piece of wood.

<title level="2">Critical Specialization Effects</title>

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 283 <sup>4.0</sup>

Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make a Strike with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

[Click here for the full rules on Critical Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=235).

<document level="2" id="weapon-group-5" />
name: Club
